text: Jean Racine (22 December 1639 – 21 April 1699) was a French playwright. He was one of the most famous of the 17th century in France (with Molière and Corneille). Racine was mostly a tragedian, even though he did write one comedy. == Works == * La Thébaïde (1664) * Alexandre le Grand (1665) * Andromaque (1667) * Les Plaideurs (1668) * Britannicus (1669) * Bérénice (1670) * Bajazet (1672) * Mithridate (1673) * Iphigénie (1674) * Phèdre (1677) * Esther (drama) (1689) * Athalie (1691) Category:French playwrights Category:1639 births Category:1699 deaths
title: Jean Racine
